title: Modular Golomb rulers and almost difference sets
abstract:
A $(v,k,\lambda)$-difference set in a group $G$ of order $v$ is a subset
$\{d_1, d_2, \ldots,d_k\}$ of $G$ such that $D=\sum d_i$ in the group ring
${\mathbb Z}[G]$ satisfies $$D D^{-1} = n + \lambda G,$$ where $n=k-\lambda$.
In other words, the nonzero elements of $G$ all occur exactly $\lambda$ times
as differences of elements in $D$.
  A $(v,k,\lambda,t)$-almost difference set has $t$ nonzero elements of $G$
occurring $\lambda$ times, and the other $v-1-t$ occurring $\lambda+1$ times.
When $\lambda=0$, this is equivalent to a modular Golomb ruler. In this paper
we investigate existence questions on these objects, and extend previous
results constructing almost difference sets by adding or removing an element
from a difference set.
